alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 6:00PM PDT until August 21 at 8:15PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Far southeastern San Luis Obispo County, northeast Santa Barbara County, including the Cuyama Valley, and northwest Ventura County in southwest California. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cuyama, Ventucopa, Carrizo Plain and Highway 166 between Twitchell Dam, the Cuyama Valley, and Plant Fire burn area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
